title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2016 Coudel Mor Clássico Red (Tejo)
description: This rich and ripe wine is softly textured and made to be drunk. Attractive berry flavors are shot with acidity and bolstered by the right tannic structure. Drink the wine now.

title: Barrelhouse 2016 Red (California)
description: This generous and fruity wine doesn't overdo the barrel treatment but packs a lot of blackberry and raisin flavors into a medium-bodied frame. Mild tannins add some good structure to the mouthfeel to balance a touch of sweetness.

title: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2016 Tolentino Winemaker's Selection Malbec (Mendoza)
description: A cloudy red color and earthy aromas of wet cement, raisin and berry fruits set up a fleshy palate without much intensity or depth. Charred, minty berry and plum flavors finish hollow.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2016 Stony Point Vineyard Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: This wine doesn't taste fully integrated, its marriage of fruit, oak and tannin still elbowing each other for space. The aromas are earthy and tinged in a flash of forest.

title: Dolmo 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Savory, meaty aromas are strained, roasted, oaky and low on fruit. This young Ribera del Duero from the Vicente Gandia family of wines is raw and underdeveloped on the palate. Roasted berry flavors are short on ripeness and taste gritty in front of a hollow finish.

title: Encosta do Sobral 2015 Syrah (Tejo)
description: Perfumed and intensely rich, this dense wine is massive and should come with a caution about its alcohol. The ripeness of the fruit leaves little room for any acidity, so the wine comes across as flat and one-dimensional. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Et Fille 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The low alcohol seems to be an indicator that these grapes were not quite ripe when picked. Flavors confirm that impression, with sour, thin, herbal fruit that needed more sunlight to flesh out the flavors.

title: Game of Thrones 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Whether Game of Thrones watchers are Pinot Noir lovers remains to be seen, but this utterly ordinary, vanilla-soaked wine is not likely to make any converts. It was vinted and bottled in Hopland, California, from purchased Oregon fruit. Sweet berry, cocoa and vanilla flavors combine in a syrupy wine that bears little resemblance to mainstream Oregon Pinot Noir.

title: LangeTwins 2015 River Ranch Vineyard Montepulciano (Lodi)
description: Dramatic oaky aromas and flavors make this estate-grown wine a bit of a one-note song, as wood smoke and black pepper dominate. It is full bodied, moderately tannic and has a mouth-filling texture.

title: Marshall Davis 2015 Seven Hills Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: Vanilla, tire rubber, char and cherry aromas are followed by ripe black fruit flavors with a lightly tacky feel. The tannins give a squeeze. It finishes warm.

title: Maryhill 2015 Serendipity Proprietor's Reserve Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up just over half of this wine, with the balance being Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Dried herb, graphite and cherry candy aromas are followed by somewhat woody, straightforward fruit flavors.

title: Original House Wine 2016 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of green herb, sweet black currant and sugared plum are followed by lightly sweet fruit flavors. It's a straightforward, easy drinker.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Rector Creek Block 4 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 52% Petit Verdot with 48% Zinfandel for an intensely tannic expression of dried herb and clove that overwhelms.

title: Raphael 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (New York)
description: Aromas of milky white flowers and savory white beans carry to the light-bodied palate and join broader flavors of melon and lemon. There's a pleasing roundness to the midpalate, yet disjointed acidity takes hold on the finish.

title: Roberto Sarotto 2015 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals raisin and candied-orange aromas. The extracted palate offers marinated prune, espresso and vanilla alongside grainy, astringent tannins.

title: Sobon Estate 2015 Red A Premium Red (Amador County)
description: Fairly rich and ripe tasting, this medium-bodied wine has strong oak aromas and flavors that register as cedar, tobacco, dill and pine. It is light in terms of tannin and acidity, has a touch of sweetness and feels very smooth in texture.

title: Bougrier 2017 Cuvée V Douce France  (Vouvray)
description: Crisp and clean, this is a ripe, honeyed wine. With citrus to balance the honey and a touch of minerality, it is attractive and balanced. Packed with acidity at the end, it is ready to drink.

title: Canard-Duchêne NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: A soft wine that has a high dosage, this offers plenty of strawberry flavors and gentle acidity. It is open, full of fruit and ready to drink.

title: Coelho 2016 Paciência Coelho Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: It's not clear what happened here, other than that the vegetal aromas and flavors suggest unripe fruit in the mix. The wine spent 14 months in 30% new oak, which can be detected in a certain toasty component, but sticks out from the herbal/vegetal core like a sore thumb. Maybe more bottle aging will smooth it over a bit.

title: Dios Ares 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Berry aromas are fiery and scratchy at first, then break down and become suggestive of olive. High acidity and not much body create crispness but also tart plum and cranberry flavors. Loud acidity is maintained on a raw finish.
